design_intent.player_goal: Master resilience concepts for SY0-701: high availability, backup/recovery strategies (RTO/RPO, replication, journaling), and layered physical security controls and sensors.

trap_list.name: Incremental vs Differential backups
trap_list.misconception: Incremental = changes since last backup; Differential = changes since last full backup.
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: Incremental = changes since last backup; Differential = changes since last full backup.

trap_list.name: Hot vs Warm vs Cold sites
trap_list.misconception: Hot = ready + current data; Warm = gear mostly ready but needs data restore; Cold = space/utilities, slowest to recover.
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: Hot = ready + current data; Warm = gear mostly ready but needs data restore; Cold = space/utilities, slowest to recover.

trap_list.name: Synchronous vs Asynchronous replication
trap_list.misconception: Sync = minimal data loss but higher latency; Async = lower latency but can lose recent writes.
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: Sync = minimal data loss but higher latency; Async = lower latency but can lose recent writes.

trap_list.name: Replication vs Journaling
trap_list.misconception: Replication copies state to another system; Journaling records transactions for point-in-time replay between backups.
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: Replication copies state to another system; Journaling records transactions for point-in-time replay between backups.

trap_list.name: Load balancing vs Clustering
trap_list.misconception: Load balancing distributes client requests; clustering coordinates nodes as one logical system/service.
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: Load balancing distributes client requests; clustering coordinates nodes as one logical system/service.

trap_list.name: RTO vs RPO
trap_list.misconception: RTO = how fast you must restore service; RPO = how far back you can lose data (time).
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: RTO = how fast you must restore service; RPO = how far back you can lose data (time).

trap_list.name: Deterrent vs Detective physical controls
trap_list.misconception: Fences/lighting/signage deter; cameras/sensors/alarms detect. Mix them in layers.
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: Fences/lighting/signage deter; cameras/sensors/alarms detect. Mix them in layers.

trap_list.name: Mantrap vs Door with badge reader
trap_list.misconception: A mantrap/access-control vestibule uses interlocked doors to prevent tailgating; a single badge door doesn't.
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: A mantrap/access-control vestibule uses interlocked doors to prevent tailgating; a single badge door doesn't.

trap_list.name: UPS vs Generator
trap_list.misconception: UPS bridges immediate short outages and conditions power; generator supplies longer-term power once started.
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: UPS bridges immediate short outages and conditions power; generator supplies longer-term power once started.

trap_list.name: Nearline vs Online backups
trap_list.misconception: Nearline is not instant but retrievable without humans (tape robot/cold cloud). Online is immediately accessible.
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: Nearline is not instant but retrievable without humans (tape robot/cold cloud). Online is immediately accessible.

missions.name: Resilient Architecture Basics
missions.goal: Build intuition for resilience: redundancy, single points of failure, load balancing vs clustering, and site/architecture choices that keep services up.

coaching_tips: Resilience is mostly about removing single points of failure and shrinking blast radius.
Load balancing distributes requests; clustering coordinates nodes to act like one system.
RTO is about downtime; RPO is about data loss (time).

missions.name: Backups, Replication, and Recovery
missions.goal: Master backup types, replication/journaling trade-offs, and recovery planning (restoration order, RTO/RPO, key management).

coaching_tips: Incremental vs differential is a classic trap—anchor to 'since last backup' vs 'since last full'.
Journaling enables point‑in‑time recovery between backups; replication keeps a copy elsewhere.
Encrypt backups, but treat key management as life support—no keys, no restore.

missions.name: Physical Security in Layers
missions.goal: Learn the layered approach to facility security: deterrence, delay, detection, and response—plus sensors, cameras, and common attacks.

coaching_tips: Think in layers: deter → delay → detect → respond.
Mantraps/vestibules stop tailgating. Bollards stop cars. Sensors/cameras detect.
When choices look 'human vs tech', cost and reliability often drive the answer (e.g., guards).

boss.premise: Synthesize resilience + recovery + physical controls under time pressure. Expect trap questions and trade-off decisions.
